results.title: A Return to Freedom, After Nearly a Year Trapped Indoors Under Lockdown

results.title: Germany Arrests British Embassy Worker Suspected of Spying for Russia

results.title: Sicily Registers Record-High Temperature as Heat Wave Sweeps Italian Island
results.abstract: A monitoring station on the island reported a temperature of 119.84 Fahrenheit, 48.8 degrees Celsius, on Wednesday. If verified, it would be the highest ever recorded in Europe.

results.title: Your Daily Coffee Habit Is About to Get More Expensive
results.abstract: Climate shocks in Brazil and shipping bottlenecks have pushed the price of coffee beans sharply higher. Starbucks says it won’t be affected for more than a year, but small cafes can’t hold off that long.

results.title: Thousands in Germany get extra shots after a nurse is suspected of tampering with the vaccine.
results.abstract: The nurse admitted to replacing six vaccine doses with a saline solution. The police suspect that she may have done so with many others during her time working at a clinic early this year.

results.title: Andrew Cuomo and #MeToo
results.abstract: It was a big news day: Gov. Andrew Cuomo announced his resignation, and the Senate passed a trillion-dollar infrastructure bill.

results.title: Bangladesh, Citing Economic Pain, Reopens Amid Worst Covid Wave Yet
results.abstract: The government is lifting a lockdown despite warnings from health experts that the outbreak could worsen.
results.byline: By Saif Hasnat and Karan Deep Singh

multimedia.caption: Dr. Shamema Akter at Dhaka Medical College Hospital last week. “We have prepared ourselves to work for long hours,” she said as Bangladesh faces a third wave of coronavirus infections, its deadliest yet.
multimedia.copyright: Fabeha Monir for The New York Times
